intro: Hypochaeris rutea, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces yellow flowers that bloom from spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, rough, and have a slightly serrated edge, while its stem is usually hairy. Hypochaeris rutea is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
